name: Holiday Inn Express Rome - San Giovanni

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel prices in Rome are generally some of the highest in Europe and so it was great to find this affordable hotel in easy reach of the city centre.
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel in ten minutes walk from the Ponte Lungo underground station (line A) that allows easy and cheap access to the city centre. A standard ticket is only one euro and within 10 mins you can be standing in the centre of one of the world's most beautiful city centres.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — No pool & bar isnt well stocked (there is a wine shop on the corner though)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a modern built building in a largely residential area with clean spacious air conditioned rooms and nice bathrooms. Breakfast is included in the price and is a buffet affair with a wide choice on offer.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although there are not a huge amount of restaurants in the immediate area, it is cheap and easy to get to the city centre whether it be by the underground or by taxi. If using a taxi, make sure you are strapped in as driving in Rome is not for the faint hearted. In fact, unless you have to, don't drive in Rome. The number of dents on cars is for a reason!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Great Breakfast, Absolute Delight to stay in....

likes.disliked: — Not the best views of Rome, but was in a residential area so was quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the hotel was most enjoyable and was a perfect base to see the city. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Some minuses
reviews.text: Okay, so we are staying at the hotel right now and wireless access in the room is not free.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As has been mentioned, the hotel's room rate is the big plus, and there is public transportation somewhat readily available. But the Metro stop is a good 10 minutes walk that is not exactly pleasant, and during our stay this week (July 2 - July 7) the Metro only runs till 21:00, supposedly due to some construction work. But the hotel staff made no effort to inform the residents of this, even though most of us rely on the Metro to return from the city center, which is at least 20 minutes away. Buses coming back to the hotel from the city center are not frequent.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced, & very clean hotel in Rome

likes.disliked: — It was not right in the centre of Rome, but what do you expect for the price..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel staff is young, as has been pointed out. And while in the past they may have been helpful (judging from previous reviewers), they are no longer that. They seem busy with something all the time, and rather impatient in answering questions.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in early afternoon, we were given a room that's not what we requested, and when we complained, we were given a room facing the train tracks. So we had to shuttle among rooms before we get what we needed. Also, the room key machine apparently was not working that afternoon and so we did not get our room keys until later in the day.
reviews.title: Nice clean modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is one of the hotel's best points. The room is modern and clean, but has no closets or shelf space to speak of.
reviews.title: Call your own taxi!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I originally booked a room for 5 nights beginning April 30th, but due to the heat (hotel refused to turn on a/c), noise from the train coming what seemed like every 15 minutes (loud screeching brakes) and the unhelpful staff we left early. We paid approximately $200 a night for a small room with a double bed.
reviews.title: No airconditioning, very loud train noise, very unhelpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was hot in Rome at the end of April and the hotel staff advised they could not turn on the a/c due to there being a law in Rome prohibiting air conditioning being used before June 1st (I don't know whether this is true or not, if it is true why is it not stated as such on their website). I asked for a fan, they advised they did not have any. I asked where I could buy a fan, they did not help me at all. Again, due to the heat we had to leave our balcony door open when we were in the room (even at night). This made me feel insecure as our balcony connected with other balconies and anyone could have come in our room during the night. With the door constantly open we had no privacy either. The noise from the train may have been at an acceptable level if we had been able to keep the balcony door closed.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will not stay here again.
reviews.title: great value,
stolen baggage from the lobby
reviews.text: Spent an excellent 4 days at this hotel. Staff very friendly and hotel clean. Although out of the city centre a minibus is provided in the mornings and late afternoon/evenings to the nearest tube. This made traveling in and out of the centre easy and you also get to experiene life on public transport. wow!!! so busy at all times but half the fun was getting on and eventually getting off.. great would def reccomend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: a lovely hotel, in a working class neighborhood
reviews.title: No Air Conditioning And Train Noise

likes.liked: — clean, modern room, location on outskirts of Rome but easy access via public transport to center
likes.disliked: — lack of air conditioning while we were there, despite fact that Rome was already warm; noise from trains

reviews.title: Great Place to stay
reviews.text: We were in Rome in May 2006. Finding a hotel was key to our trip. We found this one on line and the price was good. When we got there we were plesantly surprised. The receptionists were very accomodating. We need a place to put luggage for 6 people who just finished a 26 day cruise. They had a room for all of it. Then they locked it up. While we waited for our room we were offered the option of having a little breakfast. When we went into the room we were amazed with the selection. There were eggs, sausage, sweet rolls. fruit, yogurt, and much more. After going to our room , which was larger than we thought it would be and appointed well. We went out and wandered around the area of the hotel. We found a little pizza place with a gelato place next door. There were severl restaurants around and we found a grocery store within walking distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a tour for the next day but the following day we took the bus to the center of Rome. We then used the double decker bus to sightsee.
reviews.title: Good modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The time at this area was very nice.
reviews.title: Just perfect
Very good hotel
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night stay here.Booked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor. Clean, modern rooms typical of the chain. Beds comfortable , good lighting and decor; hotel is fairly new I think. Location not central but good bus and metro connections; 5 minutes to bus which goes to colosseum and about 10 minutes to Ponte Lungo metro which takes you most places. Small supermarket on way from metro. Taxi to Ciampino 25 euros. Staff very friendly and efficient. Breakfast mainly continental type. Highly recommend this hotel. Would definitely stay here again. Noise from adjacent train station not too much of a distraction. Courtyard rooms quieter.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this Express by Holiday Inn after having read many good critics about it on Tridadvisor internet site and we must say that we were very satisfied with our choice. Our 4-day trip to Rome was just perfect. The hotel is quite modern. The English-speaking staff at reception was very nice and helpful. The room was really clean and spacious. The buffet breakfast was the most amazing one we've ever seen in a hotel.
reviews.title: Greath Hotel, Value For Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the hotel for the may day bank holiday weekend 5th to 8th May, the staff were great, the rooms were clean and breakfast was fantastic. Buses 85 and 16 located 2 minutes walk away go straight into town in 15 minutes, and metro is not to far either. The only thing is that it can be a bit noisy if your room is facing the railway which runs behind the hotel when trains come past. But this should not deter you in any way, definately value for money and i would stay there again
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although disappointed to be despatched to the Holiday Inn Express Rome East for the first night, we were transported back in good time for a splendid breakfast the following day. Hotel is close to number 85 bus stop as described in other reviews - easy access to Colosseum and Forum as well as the Pantheon. Metro line A with access to everything else 10 minutes away. Don't bother with Shuttle/metro transfers from Ciampano unless you are on a budget. The Metro journey was dire (rush hour) and busy Romans just push you out of the way (much as we do to tourists in London I suppose!). The return to Ciampano was only 20 euro for the two of us (and our luggage) and took less than 20 minutes (2 hours on way out).
reviews.title: Excellent value
Brilliant choice do yourself a favour and book
reviews.text: Our room was good with a balcony overlooking the courtyard. You could still hear the trains and planes with the windows open, but not when closed. Maid service excellent. As you gather from other reviews the breakfasts were amazing- loads of variety and standard very high.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are a family of four traveling to Rome, good luck trying to find reasonably priced accomodations with decent quality. Well, it is possible. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express San Giovanni in Rome for 3 nights just before Easter. It is in a mostly residential area on the outskirts of Rome. You have to walk through a slightly run-down street but we did not feel uncomfortable. Getting into the city is easy because the hotel is less than ten minutes walk from two metro stations, or literally around the corner from the train station which connects to the airport and city center. Though close to the train tracks, there were no issues. We got 2 double rooms because the hotel does not have quads, but we still paid less than we would have for a skanky double in the city. The hotel is practically new, and our rooms were very clean with no maintenance issues. They serve a good breakfast with the usual Italian offerings (no fresh cooked to order, lots of pastries). If you ask, they will make a fresh espresso or cappucino, but the brewed cafe Americano is reasonable (European strength, not weak). On the nearby main avenue is a great family restaurant called Pizza Pasta, or Pasta Pizza, or something like that. Really good food, well priced, but the desserts were weak.
reviews.title: Good Budget Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (2 adults, 2 children) stayed here from 28 May to 1 June 2007 (4 nights). Our room was very close to the railway line (see photo). So after the first night, I asked to be moved to another room. However, I was told that the hotel was full. I asked again on the following day and this time they moved me to a room away from the railway line (still I could hear the trains). The downside was new room was smaller.
reviews.title: Average hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Where to begin? I made reservations well in advance. Judging by the earlier reviews I made a request to be placed away from the noise of the nearby train station. So what happened when we arrived? They did not have the room they promised. Instead I was placed in a room that had a view of the rails. To be honest the noise wasn't that bad when the windows were closed, but it was a mistake nonetheless.
reviews.title: I hated this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After two days of replacing our bed sheets and pillow cases they decided to stop and simply stayed with the used ones. I have never seen this done before in the states. I had to ask them to change the bed sheets after our third night there.
reviews.title: Good modern clean hotel, little far out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Around our 7th night there the air conditioning stopped working. I complained about this but they simply said that it was a city wide problem, something about power conservation or something like that. I couldn't really get a straight answer from them. Anyway we had no air conditioning our last three nights there. We had to have our windows open in the evenings, luckily trains weren't that frequent.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Clean and comfortable, and amazing breakfast.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Rome - San Giovanni Hotel
description: Holiday Inn Express Rome San Giovanni provides a charming and relaxing atmosphere nearly in the heart of Rome, thanks to young and qualified Staff, comfortable rooms and a spacious courtyard, ideally location for tasting an appetizers or having some rest at the end of a hard work day or after a sightseeing tour. Recently built and renovated in 2010, the Hotel offers 120 fully furnished rooms with brand new sommiers and anatomical mattresses, eiderdown, 2 graduated compression pillows per person, flat 32" TV set with 6 free of charge Sky channels, pay TV, direct dial telephone, air conditioning system, bathrooms with shower and liquid soap dispensers to protect the environment. A tasty complimentary buffet breakfast waits to wake you up, where it is possible to choose among over 100 products, many of them freshly home – made as pastries, season fruit gateaux, candied or dried fruit cakes and croissants. High speed internet WIFI connection in all areas and private garage, with direct access to the Lobby, are at disposal. The Hotel is located in the south part of the Centre of Rome, near the famous Basilica of San Giovanni in Laterano. The nearest underground station is located at 5 minutes walking distance from the Hotel (820 yards / 750 m.). The most interesting monuments of Rome as the Colosseum and the Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza di Spagna and Via Condotti, Piazza Navona and Pantheon, St. Peter’s Basilica and the Vatican Museums (Sistine Chapel) are easily reachable within a 15/20 minutes underground trip.
